resources.string: Please enter a message to send in the box below and press "Send"
Listed below are the surveys that you have missed. Please select one to complete it now
This is the Jeeves ESM application. From here, you can edit your settings, complete missed surveys, or contact your researcher
Snooze Jeeves - this will stop all notifications for your set time.
Choose how long to snooze Jeeves for. This will stop all notifications for your selected time.
Please accept all necessary permissions for your study to run properly.
For Jeeves to run properly, you still need to enable the necessary permissions. Press OK to open the Jeeves settings, from which you can access the Permissions menu.
You are not currently signed up to any studies. If you have a Study ID, please enter it here and your study will begin.
If you are just trying out the app, please select one of the open studies below!
Place your index finger lightly over the camera lens as shown. Hold your phone steady and press \'Start sensing\' when ready
Press the button below to begin playing the audio file

Jeeves recognises your account but was unable to find your credentials. This could be because you cleared the application data. Please confirm your password and press the button below to reset your account.
If you have any questions regarding data sensitivity and protection, please contact Daniel Rough at djr53@st-andrews.ac.uk

Permission is required to allow the app to send SMS messages automatically. This functionality is at the discretion of the researcher who has designed the study you have been assigned to, and contact information and SMSs sent cannot be viewed by us (the developers).

Depending on the researcher\'s study design, the app may also track your location. A researcher may wish to geotag your survey responses. As before, this data will not be available to us (the developers) and will only be available to the researcher who has designed your study.

You will be required to register and create login credentials (including your first name, surname, email address and password). This personally identifiable information is encrypted through Google\'s Firebase database, is accessible only to the researcher who has designed the study you sign up to, and is not available to us (the developers).

Depending on the researcher\'s study design, the app may also track your activity. This information is limited to determing whether you are stationary, walking, running, driving etc, and no more specific activity information will be collected. As before, this data will not be available to us (the developers) and will only be available to the researcher who has designed your study.
With the exception of the researcher who has designed the study you sign up to, no other third party, including us (the developers) have access to any personally identifiable information.
The application also uses RSA public/private key encryption so that all data is encrypted using the java.security and javax.crypto packages, before being sent through HTTP to an online database.
Withdrawal of consent and deletion of data

We as app developers have no access to any personally identifiable information. We have \'write-only\' access, meaning that we can delete your data but cannot read it. You have full rights to have your data removed. If you wish for data collected on you to be removed, please contact us using the contact details above and this will be done.
